t: Matthew 8
Jesus Cleanses a Leper; The Centurion’s Faith
When*p Jesus came down from the mountain, large crowds followed Him.
And a leper came to Him and bowed down before Him, and said, “Lord, if You are willing, You can make me clean.”
Jesus stretched out His hand and touched him, saying, “I*r am*r willing;*r be*r cleansed.”*r And immediately his leprosy was cleansed.

And Jesus said to him, “See*r that*r you*r tell*r no*r one;*r but*r go,*r show*r yourself*r to*r the*r priest*r and*r present*r the*r offering*r that*r Moses*r commanded,*r as*r a*r testimony*r to*r them.”*r
And*p when Jesus entered Capernaum, a centurion came to Him, imploring Him,
and saying, “Lord, my servant is lying paralyzed at home, fearfully tormented.”
Jesus said to him, “I*r will*r come*r and*r heal*r him.”*r
But the centurion said, “Lord, I am not worthy for You to come under my roof, but just say the word, and my servant will be healed.
For I also am a man under authority, with soldiers under me; and I say to this one, ‘Go!’ and he goes, and to another, ‘Come!’ and he comes, and to my slave, ‘Do this!’ and he does it.”*i
Now when Jesus heard this,*i He marveled and said to those who were following, “Truly*r I*r say*r to*r you,*r I*r have*r not*r found*r such*r great*r faith*r with*r anyone*r in*r Israel.*r
I*r say*r to*r you*r that*r many*r will*r come*r from*r east*r and*r west,*r and*r recline*r at*ir the*ir table*ir with*r Abraham,*r Isaac*r and*r Jacob*r in*r the*r kingdom*r of*r heaven;*r
but*r the*r sons*r of*r the*r kingdom*r will*r be*r cast*r out*r into*r the*r outer*r darkness;*r in*r that*r place*r there*r will*r be*r weeping*r and*r gnashing*r of*r teeth.”*r
And Jesus said to the centurion, “Go;*r it*r shall*r be*r done*r for*r you*r as*r you*r have*r believed.”*r And the servant was healed that very*i moment.
Peter’s Mother-in-law and Many Others Healed
When*p Jesus came into Peter’s home, He saw his mother-in-law lying sick in bed with a fever.
He touched her hand, and the fever left her; and she got up and waited on Him.
When evening came, they brought to Him many who were demon-possessed; and He cast out the spirits with a word, and healed all who were ill.
This*i was*i to fulfill what was spoken through Isaiah the prophet: “He*s Himself*s took*s our*s infirmities*s and*s carried*s away*s our*s diseases.”*s
Discipleship Tested
Now*p when Jesus saw a crowd around Him, He gave orders to depart to the other side of*i the*i sea.*i
Then a scribe came and said to Him, “Teacher, I will follow You wherever You go.”
Jesus said to him, “The*r foxes*r have*r holes*r and*r the*r birds*r of*r the*r air*r have*ir nests,*r but*r the*r Son*r of*r Man*r has*r nowhere*r to*r lay*r His*r head.”*r
Another of the disciples said to Him, “Lord, permit me first to go and bury my father.”
But Jesus said to him, “Follow*r Me,*r and*r allow*r the*r dead*r to*r bury*r their*r own*r dead.”*r
When*p He got into the boat, His disciples followed Him.
And behold, there arose a great storm on the sea, so that the boat was being covered with the waves; but Jesus Himself was asleep.
And they came to Him*i and woke Him, saying, “Save us,*i Lord; we are perishing!”
He said to them, “Why*r are*r you*r afraid,*r you*r men*r of*r little*r faith?”*r Then He got up and rebuked the winds and the sea, and it became perfectly calm.
The men were amazed, and said, “What kind of a man is this, that even the winds and the sea obey Him?”
Jesus Casts Out Demons

When*p He came to the other side into the country of the Gadarenes, two men who were demon-possessed met Him as they were coming out of the tombs. They*i were*i so extremely violent that no one could pass by that way.
And they cried out, saying, “What business do we have with each other, Son of God? Have You come here to torment us before the time?”
Now there was a herd of many swine feeding at a distance from them.
The demons began*i to entreat Him, saying, “If You are*i going*i to*i cast us out, send us into the herd of swine.”
And He said to them, “Go!”*r And they came out and went into the swine, and the whole herd rushed down the steep bank into the sea and perished in the waters.
The herdsmen ran away, and went to the city and reported everything, including what had happened to the demoniacs.
And behold, the whole city came out to meet Jesus; and when they saw Him, they implored Him to leave their region.
